text: Monopetalotaxis doleriformis is a moth of the family Sesiidae. It is known from South Africa. The larvae bore the roots of Aspalathus linearis. They are considered one of the principal insect pest associated with rooibos or red bush tea production. Pathogenic fungi and bacteria can easily develop in the bored tunnels, causing indirect damage.Plant Research International uses aromatic substances to increase yields for rooibos tea ==References== Category:Sesiidae Category:Moths of Africa
title: Monopetalotaxis doleriformis
